Bitcoin (BTC): Fidelity ระบุระดับ $65K เป็น 'จุดเข้าซื้อที่น่าสนใจ'

Bitcoin (BTC): Fidelity Identifies $65K as 'Attractive Entry Point'

1h ago//Alex Dovbnya
bitcoin
AI

Summary

TH

Jurrien Timmer ผู้อำนวยการฝ่ายมหภูมิภาคโลกของ Fidelity Investments ได้ระบุว่าระดับราคา $65,000 เป็นจุดเข้าซื้อที่น่าสนใจสำหรับ Bitcoin หลังจากสกุลเงินดิจิทัลนี้ฟื้นตัวจากการดิ่งลงสู่ระดับ $60,000 แม้ว่าตลาดจะเต็มไปด้วยความกลัว Timmer ก็ยังคงยืนยันความเชื่อมั่นในแนวรับของราคา แต่ก็ยอมรับว่าทองคำกำลังทำผลงานได้ดีกว่า Bitcoin ในขณะนี้เนื่องจากความต้องการจากธนาคารกลางและความตึงเครียดทางภูมิรัฐศาสตร์ Timmer มองว่าการที่ทองคำนำหน้า Bitcoin เป็นเพียงเรื่องของตำแหน่งทางเทคนิค ไม่ใช่ปัญหาพื้นฐานของ Bitcoin เขาเน้นย้ำว่าในสภาพเศรษฐกิจปัจจุบัน พันธบัตรระยะยาวล้มเหลวในการปกป้องนักลงทุน ทำให้ 'สินทรัพย์คงทน' (hard assets) มีความสำคัญในการกระจายการลงทุน นอกจากนี้ เขายังเน้นถึงความเร็วในการเติบโตของ Bitcoin ที่บรรลุมูลค่าตลาด $1.8 ล้านล้านดอลลาร์ในเวลาเพียง 18 ปี ซึ่งเร็วกว่า Silver ที่ใช้เวลาถึง 5 พันปี

EN

Fidelity Investments' director of global macro, Jurrien Timmer, has identified the $65,000 level as an attractive entry point for Bitcoin following the asset's recovery from a dip to $60,000. Despite recent market fear, Timmer reaffirmed his conviction in this price floor, though he acknowledged that gold is currently outperforming Bitcoin due to strong demand from central banks and geopolitical tensions. Timmer attributes gold's recent lead to technical positioning rather than fundamental issues with Bitcoin. He emphasizes that in the current economic environment, traditional portfolios are struggling as bonds fail to protect investors, making 'hard assets' crucial for diversification. Furthermore, he highlighted Bitcoin's historic speed in reaching a $1.8 trillion market cap in just 18 years, a feat that took Silver five millennia to achieve.

Key Points

  • Fidelity's Jurrien Timmer identifies $65k as an attractive entry point for Bitcoin.
  • Gold is outperforming Bitcoin due to technical positioning and geopolitical factors, not Bitcoin's fundamental failure.
  • Bitcoin reached a $1.8 trillion market cap in 18 years, significantly faster than Silver's 5,000-year timeline.

Article

After a massive V-shaped recovery from its flash crash to $60,000, one of the world's largest asset managers has indicated that the bottom might be in. Jurrien Timmer, the director of global macro at Fidelity Investments, has publicly identified the mid-$60k range as a critical buy zone. The key price point The broader market was fixated on macro headlines last week, but Timmer kept his eye on Bitcoin's technicals. Despite the fear that gripped the market earlier today, he reaffirmed his conviction in the asset's price floor. HOT Stories "The markets spoke loudly last week to the next Fed Chair being announced," Timmer wrote. "For Bitcoin, though, I continue to view $65k as an attractive entry point." Gold will keep outperforming Bitcoin Timmer also addressed the "elephant in the room", which is the fact that gold has recently outperformed its digital counterpart. Gold has surged to new all-time highs due to central bank buying and geopolitical fear. Timmer attributes this lag to technical positioning rather than a fundamental failure of Bitcoin. You Might Also Like "Given the distance between gold and Bitcoin vis-à-vis their support levels," Timmer explained, "I suspect that gold will continue to outpace Bitcoin until the flows converge further." Timmer shared what he described as a "somewhat cosmic-looking chart" tracking commodities and bonds since the cyclical bull market began in October 2022. The data highlights a stark reality for traditional 60/40 portfolios: long-term bonds are failing to protect investors, while "hard assets" are soaring. "In my view, commodities (including precious metals) continue to serve as important diversifiers in this era of fiscal dominance, regardless of who finances the debt and how," Timmer stated. He noted that precious metals have "quickly... risen in the ranks despite their very low correlation" to the S&P 500, effectively taking market share from Bitcoin in recent months. In contrast, long bonds remain "dead last," warning that if bonds become positively correlated with stocks again, investors will desperately need "uncorrelated assets (including alts) to navigate risks." 18 years vs. 5 millennia In a chart comparing the inflation-adjusted market capitalizations of monetary assets, he noted that gold currently sits at roughly $35 trillion, while Silver and Bitcoin are tied at approximately $1.8 trillion. The speed at which Bitcoin reached that milestone, however, is unprecedented in human history. "It’s amazing to me that it took Bitcoin 18 years to reach a market cap of $1.8 trillion; it took silver five millennia," Timmer observed. "Apples to oranges of course, but still."
